title: Single Select Field
description: Single selection dropdown from predefined options. Users can choose exactly one value from the list. Useful for status fields (Active, Inactive, Pending), categories, priority levels (High, Medium, Low), and enumerated values. Requires at least one option. Supports default value. Indexing improves filtering by option value.

x-specs.given: table configuration with single-select field 'priority' (options: High, Medium, Low)
x-specs.then: PostgreSQL VARCHAR column with CHECK constraint for enum values is created

setup.executeQuery: CREATE TABLE tasks (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY)

assertions.executeQuery: SELECT column_name, data_type FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name='tasks' AND column_name='priority'

assertions.description: CHECK constraint exists for enum values
assertions.executeQuery: SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM information_schema.check_constraints WHERE constraint_name LIKE '%priority%'

assertions.description: Valid option value can be inserted
assertions.executeQuery: INSERT INTO tasks (priority) VALUES ('High') RETURNING priority

x-specs.given: table 'issues' with single-select field 'status' (options: Open, In Progress, Closed)
x-specs.then: PostgreSQL CHECK constraint rejects value not in options

setup.executeQuery: CREATE TABLE issues (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, status VARCHAR(50) CHECK (status IN ('Open', 'In Progress', 'Closed')))

assertions.executeQuery: INSERT INTO issues (status) VALUES ('Open') RETURNING status
INSERT INTO issues (status) VALUES ('In Progress') RETURNING status

assertions.description: Invalid value rejected by CHECK constraint

x-specs.then: PostgreSQL enforces NOT NULL and UNIQUE constraints

executeQuery: CREATE TABLE products (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, category VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL CHECK (category IN ('Electronics', 'Clothing', 'Food')))

assertions.executeQuery: SELECT is_nullable FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name='products' AND column_name='category'
SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM information_schema.table_constraints WHERE table_name='products' AND constraint_type='UNIQUE' AND constraint_name LIKE '%category%'

assertions.expectError: duplicate key value violates unique constraint

x-specs.given: table 'tickets' with single-select field 'severity' and default value 'Low'
x-specs.when: row inserted without providing severity value

setup.executeQuery: CREATE TABLE tickets (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, severity VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Low' CHECK (severity IN ('Critical', 'High', 'Medium', 'Low')))

assertions.executeQuery: SELECT column_default FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name='tickets' AND column_name='severity'
INSERT INTO tickets (id) VALUES (DEFAULT) RETURNING severity
INSERT INTO tickets (severity) VALUES ('Critical') RETURNING severity

x-specs.given: table configuration with single-select field 'type', indexed=true
x-specs.when: index is created on the single-select field
x-specs.then: PostgreSQL btree index exists for fast filtering by option value

executeQuery: CREATE TABLE documents (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL CHECK (type IN ('PDF', 'Word', 'Excel')))

assertions.executeQuery: SELECT indexname, tablename FROM pg_indexes WHERE indexname = 'idx_documents_type'

assertions.description: Index uses btree for option filtering
assertions.executeQuery: SELECT indexdef FROM pg_indexes WHERE indexname = 'idx_documents_type'

expected.indexdef: CREATE INDEX idx_documents_type ON public.documents USING btree (type)
